lexical_diversity.description: Extensive vocabulary range spanning technical AI terminology, business language, colloquialisms, and metaphorical expressions

casual_connectors.function: Creates conversational, approachable tone; reduces formality

intensifiers.function: Emphasizes points; conveys enthusiasm and conviction

hedging_language.function: Softens claims; invites discussion; acknowledges uncertainty

examples: This is going to be fun
enthusiasm.context: When discussing AI capabilities, student progress, or project outcomes

examples: I don't think I've ever been called enthusiastic
I'm excited because... when you get this, and when you go out in the real world
I just want you all to take the time to recognize that in your own selves
mentorship.context: When addressing student concerns or celebrating progress

sentence_structure.pattern: Mixed - alternates between short, punchy statements and longer, detailed explanations

examples.medium: So what this process looks like now is as best as they could, they've tried to train members of their greenhouse sales team to do what Roger does.
examples.long: Because as a business grows, your role generally changes as a founder, and you're not able to do that same amount of stuff, and that's what we see in growers, so my dad, Roger Fisk, is the founder of Growers, and he used to literally give personalized advice to someone who would be thinking about becoming a market gardener.

examples: It's a learning process. It's not like a thing.
We want you to be comfortable with your progress. And what good enough looks like.
This is not to kind of, like, scare you or put you up for anything. It's just transparently what it takes.
What does it look like when it really sucks?
